amendment.description: An amendment numbered 3 printed in Part B of House Report 115-163 to express the sense of Congress that consumer reporting agencies and their subsidiaries should implement stronger multi-factor authentication procedures when providing access to personal information files to more adequately protect consumer information from identity theft.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 3 printed in Part B of House Report 115-163 to express the sense of Congress that consumer reporting agencies and their subsidiaries should implement stronger multi-factor authentication procedures when providing access to personal information files to more adequately protect consumer information from identity theft.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Smucker amendment (A003) Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A003) offered by Mr. Smucker.
Amendment agreed to Committee of the Whole
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Smucker amendment (A003) Agreed to by voice vote.
